pr_title: Fix NPE when secret does not contain given crt

timeline.bodyHTML:

timeline.author: scholzj

timeline.body: Could you add the warn messages as we have them with the other errors to make that consistent? Also, I think the message could you some more clarification ... maybe something like _Secret xyz does not contian certificate under the key <tls.crt>_.

timeline.body: Won't the logging here and the failure of the `thumbprintPromise` with the same message result in the message being logged twice?

timeline.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: Well it's pointless logging such things twice, so I'd drop the log stmts here and let the global handler log it.
replies.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: Sure, fine with me to remove them.
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.body:
I don't think we should use `RuntimeException` (at least in the case of a `CertificateEncodingException`, which would indicate that the user didn't create the Secret with a cert in the correct format). Remember that the exception class name gets set in the resource status, so it ought to be something helpful. I guess we could use the existing `InvalidResourceException` (though I've always thought of that as being about the consumed CR, rather than other resources)? Or Maybe a new exception class. 

The above errors for missing cert and key should use the same exception type.

timeline.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: I guess when the keys are missing it is really abotu invalid CR -> the keys listed there are wrong. When they exist but fail to decode it is a bit harder.
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.body: I guess at least this should be a `InvalidResourceException` as well.

timeline.body: We have `NoSuchResourceException` which you can use here.
